statement.text: Mesenteric duplex ultrasound is a non-invasive, non-ionizing modality that detects mesenteric arterial stenosis based on elevated velocities, with peak systolic velocities >275-300 cm/s in the SMA and >200 cm/s in the celiac artery indicating hemodynamically significant (>70%) stenosis.
statement.formal: Mesenteric Duplex Criteria: SMA PSV >275-300 cm/s → >70% stenosis | Celiac PSV >200 cm/s → >70% stenosis | No flow → occlusion

explanation.intuition: Duplex ultrasound works on a simple principle: blood flowing through a narrowed segment must speed up (like water through a kinked hose). By measuring how fast the blood is moving, we can estimate how narrow the vessel is. A stenosis causes the blood to accelerate as it squeezes through the tight spot.
explanation.key_insight: Mesenteric duplex is most valuable as a screening test for chronic mesenteric ischemia and for post-treatment surveillance. It is less useful for acute mesenteric ischemia, where the speed and comprehensiveness of CTA are preferred.

patient_preparation.hydration: May take small sips of water

celiac_artery.challenge: May be compressed by median arcuate ligament

SMA.landmark: Second major aortic branch (just below celiac)

IMA.challenge: Often occluded, may not be identifiable

measurements.waveform: Assess for damping distal to stenosis

frequency.post_stent: 1 month, then every 3-6 months year 1, annually thereafter
frequency.post_bypass: 1 month, then every 6 months year 1, annually thereafter

postprandial_testing.technique: Duplex before and after standardized meal

advantages.cost: Less expensive than CT or MR

technical: Patient must be able to fast
anatomic: Cannot assess for aneurysms as well as CT
acute_settings: Not appropriate for acute mesenteric ischemia diagnosis
CTA is preferred in emergency settings

duplex_first.follow_up: If positive, confirm with CTA before intervention

duplex_for_surveillance.follow_up: CTA if duplex suggests restenosis and intervention considered

CTA_first.role_of_duplex: Not primary, may be used for follow-up

related.relationship: CTA provides anatomic detail when duplex abnormal

sources.citation: SVS/ESVS consensus on mesenteric duplex criteria
Defined technical review on mesenteric duplex ultrasound

learning_objectives: Know velocity criteria for mesenteric stenosis
Understand appropriate applications of mesenteric duplex
Apply duplex to screening and surveillance
clinical_pearls: Duplex is for screening and surveillance, not for acute diagnosis
Fasting is essential for good study quality
PSV >275-300 cm/s in SMA suggests significant stenosis
Abnormal duplex should be confirmed with CTA before intervention
